info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 7:21PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHANY NC, ASHE AND CENTRAL GRAYSON COUNTIES... At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Baldwin. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Lansing... Mouth Of Wilson... Laurel Springs... Glendale Springs... Sugar Grove... This includes the following streams and drainages... Flag Pond Branch, Elk Creek, Darnell Creek, Dickey Creek, Dry Run, Crab Fork, Comers Rock Branch, Beaver Creek, Fox Creek, Bear Branch, Big Horse Creek, Farmers Branch, Dog Creek, Bridle Creek and Call Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
